item.title: Starmer criticised for welcoming freed Egyptian activist to UK
item.description: Alaa Abdel Fattah flew to the UK on Friday after a travel ban imposed by Cairo was lifted.

item.title: Cruise ship hits reef on first trip since leaving passenger on island
item.description: The Coral Adventurer is under investigation for the death of Suzanne Rees, who was found dead on a remote island after being left behind by the ship.

item.title: Starmer criticised for welcoming Egyptian activist
item.description: Alaa Abdel Fattah flew to the UK on Friday after a travel ban imposed by Cairo was lifted.

item.title: BBC visits Myanmar polling station as civil war rages on
item.description: Voters in Myanmar's election say the poll is taking place in a "climate of fear", the BBC's South East Asia Correspondent Jonathan Head reports.

item.title: Quiz of the Year 2025, Part 4: Who was the mysterious Fedora man pictured outside the Louvre?
item.description: Test your memory of 2025 in the final part of our quiz. What happened from October to December?

item.title: Film lookahead: 20 highlights to watch out for in 2026
item.description: We look ahead to 20 notable films to watch for in 2026, from Oscar hopefuls to potential blockbusters.

item.title: MCG curator in 'state of shock' at two-day Test
item.description: Melbourne Cricket Ground head curator Matthew Page says he was in a “state of shock” during England’s two-day defeat of Australia in the Boxing Day Test.

item.title: Fearing deportation, Hondurans in the US send more cash home than ever before
item.description: There's been a surge in remittances going back to Honduras amid Trump's immigration crackdown.

item.title: Godfather of Ethiopian jazz plays his last live concert
item.description: Mulatu Astatke has been blending jazz influences from home and abroad for the past six decades.

item.title: Snow-capped Mount Etna erupts as skiers use its slopes
item.description: Volcanic activity at the mountain intensified on 27 December, according to Italian scientists.

item.title: The Papers: 'War and peace in Ukraine' and 'Ramsay and Peaty take the plunge'
item.description: Olympic swimmer Adam Peaty and Holly Ramsay's wedding dominate Sunday's papers.

item.title: War-torn Myanmar voting in widely criticised 'sham' election
item.description: Observers say the vote, accompanied by a renewed crackdown on dissent, is meant to entrench the junta's power.

item.title: How frogs went from right-wing meme to anti-ICE protest symbol
item.description: The frog has become a frequent symbol at protests against the Trump administration.

item.title: Dark energy just got even weirder and why the Universe may end in a 'Big Crunch'
item.description: A mysterious force called Dark Energy might be changing, in a way that challenges our current understanding of the nature of time and space.

item.title: Finding out I've got ADHD has saved my life
item.description: The actor says starting ADHD medication has allowed him to put on a one-man show about his life.

item.title: Rich and voiceless: How Putin has kept Russia's billionaires on side in the war
item.description: Western sanctions have failed to turn the uber-rich into opponents, and Putin's policies have turned them into silent backers.

item.title: Style trends to look out for in 2026: Bold colours, tassels and loud luxury
item.description: These are some of the biggest trends you can expect to see hitting stores in the new year.
